caption: This photograph presents a densely packed group of individuals all wearing matching white outfits, which include head coverings and robes. The scene is filled with a diverse array of expressions and poses; most people are facing towards the camera, with several of them raising their hands in a wave or peace sign. The people appear cheerful, with many smiling broadly. The uniform white attire against a plain, indistinct background emphasizes the group's unity and the festive or celebratory nature of the occasion. The overall atmosphere conveyed by the image is one of joy and communal participation.
title: Black Muslim women dressed in white applaud Elijah Muhammad during the delivery of his annual Savior's Day message in Chicago. The city is headquarters for the Black Muslims. Their $75 million empire includes a mosque, newspaper, university restaurants, real estate, bank and variety of retail stores. Muhammad died February 25, 1975.
